Text: Re ENAPPL Citibank Escrow Agreementmy limited knowledge of escrow agreements this look fine to me Jake Kay NRON AM To Jake CT cc Subject ENAPPL Citibank Escrow Agreement fyi Forwarded by Kay MannCorpEnron on AM Campbell Carolyn SLAWcom on AM To cc Subject ENAPPL Citibank Escrow Agreement REDEscrow Agreement Enron Salmon LLCDOC Ladies and Gentlemen Enclosed is a revised draft of the Escrow Agreement marked to reflect changes from the draft previously circulated Please review and advise of any comments We hereby request that ENA and PPL provide or confirm as applicable the relevant wire transfer information in Sections and of Part I in order that execution copies may be circulated for execution later today Thank you Carolyn M Campbell King Spalding phone fax mailto EnclosurevR Confidentiality Notice This message is being sent by or on behalf of a lawyer It is intended exclusively for the individual or entity to which it is addressed This communication may contain information that is proprietary privileged or confidential or otherwise legally exempt from disclosure If you are not the named addressee you are not authorized to read print retain copy or disseminate this message or any part of it If you have received this message in error please notify the sender immediately by email and delete all copies of the message REDEscrow Agreement Enron Salmon LLCDOC

Re ENAPPL Citibank Escrow Agreementmy limited knowledge of escrow agreements this look fine to me Jake Kay NRON AM To Jake CT cc Subject ENAPPL Citibank Escrow Agreement fyi Forwarded by Kay MannCorpEnron on AM Campbell Carolyn SLAWcom on AM To cc Subject ENAPPL Citibank Escrow Agreement REDEscrow Agreement Enron Salmon LLCDOC Ladies and Gentlemen Enclosed is a revised draft of the Escrow Agreement marked to reflect changes from the draft previously circulated Please review and advise of any comments We hereby request that ENA and PPL provide or confirm as applicable the relevant wire transfer information in Sections and of Part I in order that execution copies may be circulated for execution later today Thank you Carolyn M Campbell King Spalding phone fax mailto EnclosurevR Confidentiality Notice This message is being sent by or on behalf of a lawyer It is intended exclusively for the individual or entity to which it is addressed This communication may contain information that is proprietary privileged or confidential or otherwise legally exempt from disclosure If you are not the named addressee you are not authorized to read print retain copy or disseminate this message or any part of it If you have received this message in error please notify the sender immediately by email and delete all copies of the message REDEscrow Agreement Enron Salmon LLCDOC

RE MCCook MetalsBarry Thanks for taking time Friday to meet with usSorry I missed you but I agree the meeting did go wellI think you were successful in helping Michael Lynch over his hurdle concerning transport and gas supply which you rightfully point out are two distinct and separate issues I appreciate Stephanie Millers role in assisting our group in identifying obstacles and solutions in our development effort I hope you are not thinking of redirecting her She works well with our group With regard to Longview lets coordinate the Gas Services Agreements through our development group I would prefer not to send McCook any further documentation until they have responded to our PSA and Management Agreements McCook is good at making us work and never responding They owe us some Good Faith if you know what I mean I would appreciate it if you would continue to respond to McCooks questions about transport and supplyIt sould like they need to get into an open season at the right time and you have a much better feel for that timing that I do Regards Jake Original Message From Tycholiz Barry Sent Monday July AM To Thomas Jake Subject MCCook Metals Jake sorry I missed you on Friday I took off around and assumed you were tied up with MCCook If you have time today give me a call If there is any chance that these guys are going to buy the plant then they really need to get into the open seasons with Williams and PGT timing is everything I also would like to discuss Stephanie Millers future role in the development game and would like your direct feedback Thanks for having us at the meeting I thought it went OK but there really were two seperate agendas and they were as much concerned about the price of their gas as they were interested in how it is going to get to the plant and as you know one doesnt really have to do with the other BT

RE Buffalo Power Company LLC Gas Turbine Power Plant ProjectThat actually works out perfect for my schedule Jake Thomas Original Message From Whitt Mark Sent Tuesday October AM To Thomas Jake Cc Bump Dan J Walton Steve Subject FW Buffalo Power Company LLC Gas Turbine Power Plant Project Can we meet next Tuesday on October th Afternoon is prefferable Original Message From Walton Steve Sent Tuesday October AM To Whitt Mark Subject RE Buffalo Power Company LLC Gas Turbine Power Plant Project I am booked all of this week Tuesday of next week might work if in the afternoon so I could fly in that morning Steve Original Message From Whitt Mark Sent Monday October PM To Thomas Jake Walton Steve Subject RE Buffalo Power Company LLC Gas Turbine Power Plant Project It works for me Steve would that be possible for you Original Message From Thomas Jake Sent Monday October PM To Whitt Mark Walton Steve Subject RE Buffalo Power Company LLC Gas Turbine Power Plant Project I have already made plans for the th How about later this weeks or early next Jake Thomas Original Message From Whitt Mark Sent Monday October PM To Walton Steve Cc Thomas Jake Subject RE Buffalo Power Company LLC Gas Turbine Power Plant Project I have to go to the management meeting in San Antonio on the afternoon of the th Would it be possible to meet in Denver on the morning of the th Original Message From Walton Steve Sent Monday October AM To Whitt Mark Kaufman Paul Calger Christopher F Cc Tycholiz Barry Bump Dan J Subject RE Buffalo Power Company LLC Gas Turbine Power Plant Project Mark I am committed to a meeting in Seattle with the Western Governors and the FERC on November and respectively The next meeting of the Wyoming Energy Commission is on November in Evanston and a meeting in Spokane on the th leaving the th open I know that is beyond your two week window but it would be the best time for me Steve Original Message From Whitt Mark Sent Friday October PM To Walton Steve Kaufman Paul Calger Christopher F Cc Tycholiz Barry Bump Dan J Subject Buffalo Power Company LLC Gas Turbine Power Plant Project ENA and Crestone Northern Borders nonregulated affiliate met with a group of developers and Joe Meyer Secretary of State in Wyoming who have proposed to build a MW power plant expandable to MW in the Powder River basin of Wyoming Their angle is that the existing utility Powder River Electric Coop cannot meet the demand for electricity and the necessary distribution infrastructure to maintain the pace of development in the Coal Bed Methane BOOM that is happening in the basin As you may or may not know Enron has been very involved in this Coal Bed Methane play since ENA is the largest purchaser of rd party gas in the basin and Crestone is the largest nonproducer gathering company in the basin Crestone has a gathering trunkline located near their proposed site The developers will be filing a petition to remove this area from the COOPs certificated territory in the next couple of weeks There are obviously regulatory issues revolving around their ability to gain access to this retail market and the project would not be economically feasible as a merchant plant in the wholesale market However they seem to have some political backing These developers recognize that they need Enrons assistance in developing this project on three main fronts Power Marketing and Project development Gas Supplies and Pipeline access Regulatory and Transmission expertise Given the fact that Joe Meyer is the early favorite to be the next Wyoming Governor and we are trying to work well with the State of Wyoming and we have a natural competitive advantage in this market from a gas supply and pipeline perspective I would like to pursue this opportunity a little further Therefore I am wondering if I could get a Sr Commercial Power Representative and a Regulatory Representative Steve Walton would be good since he will be on the Wyoming Energy Commission to attend a meeting in Denver with myself and the Crestone representatives sometime in the next weeks Please give me a call and I can elaborate on the opportunity or answer your questions I dont want to make this email a novel Thanks a lot

ENA and Crestone Northern Borders nonregulated affiliate met with a group of developers and Joe Meyer Secretary of State in Wyoming who have proposed to build a MW power plant expandable to MW in the Powder River basin of Wyoming Their angle is that the existing utility Powder River Electric Coop cannot meet the demand for electricity and the necessary distribution infrastructure to maintain the pace of development in the Coal Bed Methane BOOM that is happening in the basin As you may or may not know Enron has been very involved in this Coal Bed Methane play since ENA is the largest purchaser of rd party gas in the basin and Crestone is the largest nonproducer gathering company in the basin Crestone has a gathering trunkline located near their proposed site The developers will be filing a petition to remove this area from the COOPs certificated territory in the next couple of weeks There are obviously regulatory issues revolving around their ability to gain access to this retail market and the project would not be economically feasible as a merchant plant in the wholesale market However they seem to have some political backing These developers recognize that they need Enrons assistance in developing this project on three main fronts Power Marketing and Project development Gas Supplies and Pipeline access Regulatory and Transmission expertise Given the fact that Joe Meyer is the early favorite to be the next Wyoming Governor and we are trying to work well with the State of Wyoming and we have a natural competitive advantage in this market from a gas supply and pipeline perspective I would like to pursue this opportunity a little further Therefore I am wondering if I could get a Sr Commercial Power Representative and a Regulatory Representative Steve Walton would be good since he will be on the Wyoming Energy Commission to attend a meeting in Denver with myself and the Crestone representatives sometime in the next weeks Please give me a call and I can elaborate on the opportunity or answer your questions I dont want to make this email a novel Thanks a lot

FW Buffalo Power Company LLC Gas Turbine Power Plant ProjectCalger asked my to be your Sr Commercial guy on this potential tranactionIt would be helpful if you would spend a little time with me to better explain the business proposition that you see we would promote I will be available for a meeting in Denver In fact I am planning on being their the weekend of Nov Maybe we can schedule something around that date Give me a call Jake Thomas Original Message From Calger Christopher F Sent Friday October PM To Thomas Jake Subject FW Buffalo Power Company LLC Gas Turbine Power Plant
